column4: ok, so I registered my domain name with GoDaddy.com, and they gave me an IP address for my site, which they got from a DNS server, Areport
another guy asked me what my question was, I'm just reading it now
I'm just wondering how I can set up my system to recognize my registered domain name that came with a DNS-provided IP
so, yeah, I do want to edit /etc/hosts
right now, my hosts file says-
that wouldn't really help if you want other people to be able to access your site
if apache is already running on the server with that ip then there is no need to change anything
what is the address you are trying to set up?
but, for example, the other line is just --
thanks. though it's confusing, all the tutorials i've seen for setting up a server show the second format
do you know what /etc/hosts is for? :)
no but that would be ideal
